definitions.definition: A person incarcerated in a prison , while on trial or serving a sentence .
examples: Two other prisoners were staying in the same cell as him.

definitions.definition: Any person held against their will.
A person who is or feels confined or trapped by a situation or a set of circumstances .
examples: I am no longer a prisoner to fear, for I am a child of God.

main_definition: A person incarcerated in a prison , while on trial or serving a sentence .
secondary_definitions: Any person held against their will.
A person who is or feels confined or trapped by a situation or a set of circumstances .
